Review Title: Was ok, but former experiences were better.
Negative Reviews: Room 2104 - has not been well maintained or upgraded.  Have stayed in ofher rooms there that were better.  And NO HAIRDRYER.
Positive Reviews: Beds were good, room location was quiet.  Shuttle service to Terminal 2 excellent.

Negative Reviews: The decor in the bedroom was a little dated
Positive Reviews: location cleanliness staff extremely attentive and helpful

Negative Reviews:

Positive Reviews: The hotel is clean, well lit, staff are very polite and the check in process was very quick and easy. I have stayed here before and will stay here again. This is a very convenient hotel when traveling at night.

Negative Reviews: While there were small issues with two rooms (chipped tile or problem with air conditioner adjustment), overall I found the rooms comfortable, clean & reasonably priced.
Positive Reviews: I stayed at Camino Real Aeropuerto three different nights during a 3 week period. So convenient to/from Inter'l terminal and by shuttle to/from domestic terminal. Check in was easy, staff very nice & helpful, rooms clean.

Negative Reviews:
Needs updating

Positive Reviews:

Suggestions on menu and accommodations on special diet from the waiters was amazing 
But the room needs attention- looks pretty run down and the bathroom needs also replacement on tub and water faucets

Negative Reviews: Very minor thing but a kettle in the room would be nice for a cup of tea before an early flight but again is very minor.

Positive Reviews: The location is the best part if you have an early flight. There is a bridge to the airport from the hotel! Also the hotel has a restaurant and other services if you don't have time to go elsewhere. Room was nice enough, pretty standard

Review Title: Don't bother with a taxi, only a short walk from Terminal 1.
Negative Reviews: Would have liked a kettle and tea and coffee available in the room,  also could use some towel rails in the bathroom.

We like that having breakfast was in the same floor as our room. The variety was fine. By mistake we ordered room service breakfast and we went for the breakfast. The person responsible for the breakfast let us know about this and she was very kind to cancel the room service breakfast and there was not extra charge.
Some people’s review mentioned that the rooms are old but from our point of view the rooms are well maintained. The price can be a bit high but it’s understandable due to the location.

Review Title: Don’t accept a first floor room

Review Title: Ok for a day, specially if you need be  near to the airport.

I think the windows do not open. Maybe it is the cause.
Positive Reviews:

Review Title: Too expensive, convenient location for early flights.
Negative Reviews:
The interior is very dated and the room was totally overpriced. It was the most expensive hotel of our whole Mexico trip, and while the room was ok, I wouldn't recommend staying there (except if you need access to the airport). 
Also, the hotel called us a taxi for a quick trip to the city. What should have been a 20min drive, turned into an hour of us constantly checking google maps to not get lost – the driver had no idea where he was going. Took him also 15min to get his credit card device working. We exited the taxi 2 blocks early cause we kept driving in circles in the wrong direction. Should have taken an official airport taxi instead of the hotel driver, would have also been slightly cheaper.
Positive Reviews: We stayed for one night because we had an overseas flight leaving very early in the morning. Biggest asset is definitely the direct access to the airport, you can just walk over a bridge. To mention another positive thing – tap water in the room was filtered, which was very convenient.

Negative Reviews:
Sound isolation is not great. Also, the heating unit was not working in my room. 

The refub rooms are ok, and certainly looks better than few years ago.
Positive Reviews:
I was given several options to choose from in terms if room and location. 

I got one of the renewed rooms. 

Compared to the other hotels around the airport has the highest value per cost.

Negative Reviews: they charged me 7 times for two bedrooms and haven’t got my money back.

Negative Reviews: Beds were saggy and well used. Bed linens need updating.

Positive Reviews: Impossible better location, clean and very comfortable room

Review Title: Met my immediate needs but the cleanliness must be improved especially at this price.
Negative Reviews: The cleanliness was not great - there were a number of hairs in my bed, the sink had some stains when I arrived and overall the hotel seemed to need a refresh.
Positive Reviews: The location could not have been easier - I was on a late arriving flight into Mexico City airport and thanks to the tunnel, I did not even have to step outside the airport to access it. I was able to get to my much needed bed very quickly.

Review Title: Good airport hotel with some room for improvement.
Negative Reviews: It would have been good to have a kettle to boil water and some tea / coffee making facilities in the room.  Also, the room was not really good for soundproofing. The sound of noisy people in other rooms was easily heard in our room.
Positive Reviews: Just across from the Terminal 1 airport building. No need for a shuttle.  Convenient shuttle from Terminal 2 airport building too.  Very efficient check in and check out process. Room service is quick and efficient.

Review Title: A wonderful place to stay at the Mexico City airport -- once you manage to find it!
Negative Reviews:
I took a point off my overall score for this hotel because it was such a pain to find it after arriving by bus from Puebla. If I hadn't found such a good deal on the room, I would've deducted two points. It was bad.
In an effort to save the hotel future lost points and to help future guests, I will share my hard-won discoveries: You cannot see the hotel from inside the airport; from outside, you can see it once you get around Gate 5 and lower.... Do *not* follow the signs with an "H" or "bed" for "Hotel"; they will take you to the Courtyard by Marriott (which must have been the only one to cough up money for the signage).... Do *not* rely on Google maps, which has let me down on a number of occasions during Covid and no more so than in this airport.... Only ask for directions from people in the Information booths; the other official-looking people are way too important and too busy talking to their friends to help a lost tourist.... When they tell you that the hotel is by Puerta 4, realize that this door is on the lower floor. To reach the hotel, you need to be on the upper/second floor, from where you cannot see the numbers. When they tell you on that floor that you need the second "puerta" on the right, realize that there are no doors/gates up there (except doors to offices and shops). There *are* two pedestrian overpass bridges (puentes), and the Camino Real Hotel is reached via the second one. That bridge is about 5-7 minutes past the one that leads to the airport train to Terminal 2; you will see a big letter "B" over on the left side just ahead. The second bridge splits. If you go left, you reach parking, and no one there has ever heard of the Camino Real Hotel. If you go right, you will see the first and one and only sign for the Camino Real Hotel. Walk across the bridge, keeping straight (there's a right turn into the airport outbound bus station) and you will enter the lobby...
Positive Reviews: I got a very good deal on my room here but would find this to be a really solid airport hotel even if I had paid the normal rate. My room was large, comfortable, and well serviced during my 2-night stay. The wifi (which was free with my rate) worked fine. Every staff member I encountered was cheerful and attentive. The soaring atrium lobby might be a bit outdated; decked out with a big Christmas tree and creche in the center, though, it was all quite festive and airy. It was relaxing to sit in the bar and have a couple of drinks while watching NFL games. I didn't eat there. (Yes, the prices were pretty high, but it is at a major airport. There are several good, more reasonable restaurants like Hector's Agavito within a one-block radius.) I also waited there with a tequila while waiting for the results of my Covid test, which was done at the medical office right next to the reservations desk. Although my flight back to Chicago left from Terminal 2, I stayed at this hotel at Terminal 1 (which can be a real nightmare) because of the great deal and because it is right next to a metro stop into the city ("Terminal Aérea" station, Line 5). At 4:30 a.m., I only had to walk over to the terminal, down the escalator, and over to outside Gate 6 to catch the airport bus to Terminal 2 (20 pesos). The train (free) was just about to start up (at 5:00 a.m.), and it was even closer and at the same level.

Review Title: Perfect room without leaving the airport
Negative Reviews:
The hotel is quite big, but a little bit old-fashioned. The first floor (registration desk, lobby, restaurant, and bar) look nice when the rooms and the corridors are a bit 'oldish' probably because of the designs. The only thing missing in the room was a fridge.
The hotel is not that difficult to reach, but it would be much better if there would be some signs inside the airport when leaving the departure doors to understand in which direction to walk.
Positive Reviews:
The hotel has an extremely comfortable location as it connected with the airport terminal. So all you need is to get your luggage, go to the second floor of the airport terminal and have 3-4 mins walk to get to the hotel lobby.
The room has an air conditioner, clean bed sheets, clean towels, wardrobe, safe box, TV and cot ready if you are travelling with children.
On the other hand, there is a gym, restaurant, travel office, store and even the post box, so you can send a Mexican postcard directly from the hotel.
And the last thing to keep in mind is that sometimes there are queues for the check-in, probably it happens when multiple flights arrive at the same time. In this case, the check-in process will take longer, but the hotel staff works quite fast, so surely you will get your room as soon as possible. However, the check-out process is super fast, so you would not need to be worrying about missing your flight.

Negative Reviews:
Not enough drinking water in room and 1L extra water was $130mxn!!!! 

No tea/coffee making facilities in room any more. 

Beds on castors that meant resting on the headboard caused beds to slide across room. 

Price agreed with Booking.com not comparable with actual price at hotel (£40 difference per night).
Positive Reviews:
Proximity to airport T1 gates very convenient. Staff - welcome and care always excellent. 

Air-conditioning system very configurable.

Quiet room.

Negative Reviews: The hotel is very basic, dated, and misadvertised. We went for the executive floor, but didn’t see anything like hot/cold drinks on offer, no separate check in (queue is quite long). American breakfast was supposed to be included, but when we found breakfast it was a little room at the back of the lobby where we were offered eggs and fruit (not the main breakfast area). The bedding had lipstick stains on the sheets.
Positive Reviews: Staff were friendly, we were able to communicate in English. Location is good, but hard to find from the airport as lack of signs (it’s at door 4!). Room was quiet and air conditioning worked fine.
Room Type: Camino Real Club King - Breakfast Included for Adults Only

Review Title: Very convenient, easy walk from the terminals. Kind, helpful staff.

Positive Reviews: Very close to the airport which was great given than our flight arrived at 1am. Cool views of the airport and city, especially from the breakfast room. The lobby is very impressive. The staff are kind and helpful.
Room Type: Camino Real Club Two Beds - Breakfast Included for Adults Only

Negative Reviews: The room service good.
Positive Reviews:
The service room food was too overpriced and didn’t taste good. The tortilla soup was too salty it was unedible. 

However the room and he staff were great and the location is convenient.

Negative Reviews: Room size too small mainly jr suite. Bathroom taps and fittings were a bit rusty and brokenish. Water costs 4 times its price! Pool is a bit of a task to find! All plug points dont work.
Positive Reviews: Proximity to airport, restaurants within the hotel, amenities. Bed was fabulous, super comfy including pillows.

Negative Reviews: The shower temperature adjustment was slightly confusing compared to normal turn for hotter temperature as it went colder.

Negative Reviews: why is the bed on little wheels? I usually move when I sleep or when watching TV and i was going all over the place!

Review Title: Decent layover stay - very helpful staff

There was a street party next to the hotel that was so loud it was vibrating our entire room. The staff were very helpful and moved us to a room in the main building once I explained my wife was pregnant and needed to sleep.

Review Title: Quick Overniter in a luxury hotel
Negative Reviews: We had a coffee maker but no coffer pods.  That should be checked better after cleaning the room.
Positive Reviews: We always try to stay at least one night at Camino Real Aeropuerto, the location makes it very easy to arrive in the afternoon and fly out the next day.  The staff is always accommodating and treat you with respect.  The rooms are small but comfortable and the general area spaces are good to hang out in for an hour if you are waiting for your plane.
Room Type: Camino Real Club Two Beds - Breakfast Included for Adults Only

Negative Reviews:
Very noisy at the reception area. You could hear everything from our room which did not let us sleep until later. This is quite ironic given that you could not hear a plane take off or land but you could hear everything from within the hotel. 
Moreover, the indoor pool was out of service. Not ideal, particularly during high season. Spa facilities had a nasty smell, had mould in the changing rooms and turf was old and broken in most of the areas around the pool. Management needs to pay serious attention to these details and urgently make an upgrade, particularly if the hotel is classified as a five star.
Positive Reviews: Location is perfect if you have an early morning flight. Comfortable bed and staff were helpful and friendly.

Negative Reviews: The front lady wen you check in.she was the 4th from the elevator to the exit.and the bathroom it was hair on the toilet
Positive Reviews: .the location the beds and the restaurants

Negative Reviews:
Very dated hotel, in serious need of a renovation. Rooms not very appealing, with some mold joints in the bathroom.
The gym is again dated. Spin bikes/weights, although somehow finctioning,  are last century models. Again, needs some renovation.
Positive Reviews:

Review Title: A lot of unnecessary stress at arrival.
Negative Reviews:
Hated the carpet in the room.  I would prefer hard flooring for sanitary purposes.  The Ballet person was not at the front of the hotel when we arrived with our rental car and lots of luggage.
There was not enough space at the front to park the car to wait for a Ballet person.  We drove the car into the parking lot used by the hotel but not owned by the hotel and could only be Ballet parked.  There was no one to help with the luggage.  We were told to drive back to the front of the hotel.  It was a very stressful and unorganized situation.  We did not want to park the car in Ballet because we just needed to unload the luggage into our room and then return the car to the rental office.  
A hotel sign is needed we’re one must turn to find the hotel.  The carne asada tacos did not have flavor and very plain but the chicken soup was very tasty.
Positive Reviews: The location across from Terminal 1.  has a working restaurant.  Very large and nice bathroom.  Comfortable and clean beds.

Negative Reviews: Nothing. Coffee and tea facilities in the room would have been nice
Positive Reviews: Nice hotel, well designed, comfortable rooms, excellent location very close to airport

Review Title: Ok stay for one night close to the airport, but definitely in need of some renovations.
Negative Reviews: the room smelt of old cigarette smoke and was just generally tatty. the towel rail was hanging off, the door to the wardrobe was really difficult to open and just felt extremely dated and tired.
Positive Reviews: big room, really close to the airport so was very convenient

Negative Reviews: No hooks in the bathroom to hang towels. Had to hang them in the closet!
Positive Reviews: Super easy to access from terminal 1 across a foot bridge, very convenient for an early morning flight. Clean and comfortable room,  generally quiet. Complimentary toiletries were very nice

Negative Reviews: room, price, restaurant
Positive Reviews:
I’ve stayed there many times in the  past , but this time they put me in a room that was far away even though my husband had walking issues. They changed the room, but the sink faucet made noise and turned in several times during the night.
The price has double since I started staying here a couple of years ago. Not worth the price.  
There was no coffee maker in the room and breakfast is not included, and the restaurant Huerta, was not very good either.
I travel through Mexico City a couple of times a month, but will choose another hotel in the future. It is a very convenient location, but otherwise it leaves a lot to be desired.

Negative Reviews:
The window to the outside was blurred.
The bed has wheels and its constantly moving. There is no way of blocking them. Why?
I used the transport service provided to go to Terminal 2, the person who packed my bags into the van demanded a tip in a rude maner to every single customer including me. The driver of the van (different person) on the other hand was really nice and unloaded the bags professionally.
I know in hotels things are more expensive than usual, but it is the first time I had to pay 10 times the price compared to the outside for a bottle of water in the Starbucks by the Lobby
Positive Reviews:

Review Title: all in all a good experience. Good beds, bad restaurant, and we were a little unlucky with noise from the renovation at
Negative Reviews: there was alot of renovation going on, and we were disturbed by it very early one morning.  Also…. Im pretty sure that the food at the restaurant was warmed in the microwave.  I would expect ALOT more for the price we paid.
Positive Reviews: very nice beds, and perfect location for us, practically at the AirPort

Review Title: Perfectly fine, great to be so close to the airport for an early morning flight.
Negative Reviews: Would be nice to have some literature in the room about restaurants, hours, tv guide (esp. foreign language), other amenities that might be available.
Positive Reviews: Location was good.   Quick registration.  Clean room, well appointed.

Negative Reviews: We had to take a taxi to the hotel from terminal 2 because no one could tell us how to get there.  There is a train that runs from terminal 2 to 1 but it’s challenging to find. From terminal 1 it’s an easy walk over the catwalk. The rooms in the 2nd tower were older and worn and I don’t think worth the price. Breakfast was fine but overpriced. I would NOT walk around outside!
Positive Reviews: The location is great if you arrive in terminal 1; if you arrive in terminal 2 it is very difficult to find the first time.  We stayed one night in a very nice room and the 2nd night in a different tower that was very worn and challenging to get to. There is an airport shuttle from hotel to airport but it is not communicated.

Negative Reviews: After a long day of travel, it took us 2 hours to checkin. The checkin line extended to the restaurants. We did not get to our room until 11:20pm. No explanation given to anyone while in line.
Positive Reviews: The location is perfect. The rooms are always clean and comfortable.

Review Title: It's conveniently located at the terminal and a great option for overnight stays at the airport.
Negative Reviews: Even though we stayed in a newly renovated room, your matresses are still old and uncomfortable. Upgrading them is a relatively easy fix that will generate much better reviews.
Positive Reviews: Super convenient proximity to the airport. Friendly personnel. You are starting to renovate the rooms which is a plus.

Review Title: High expectations - High price - Dissapointing experience.
Negative Reviews:
I would like to state, that my observations here are not intended to hurt or speak ill of the hotel, this are just pointers that I think that management could take a look at in order to improve and make the guests' stay more pleasant.
Cleanliness is strongly lacking in the rooms. The first room that we were accommodated in (Tower 2) was not clean. Since you can not open the windows in this hotel to let in some fresh air, we could smell dust and humidity in the air, slightly moldy. At a closer look, we found layers of dust on the carpet, which makes us assume that vacuuming was thoroughly done. The bathroom again, showed signs of wear and lack of proper cleaning. The shower head had lime accumulation and you can find mold forming on the crevices of the bathtub and other areas in the bathroom. Since we suffer from allergies we got accommodated in a new room in Tower 1, which was larger and had more natural light coming in through the window. Unfortunately the situation was just slightly better, but to my surprise, when I turned on the A/C to have some fresh air pumped into the room, it just made things worst. You could breathe in the dust and humidity, probably from old filters. Nevertheless I turned the A/C off immediately after a minute or so. 
Be aware of two things, live music is played downstairs in the restaurant and can go on until 10:00pm which, for a tired traveler, might not be the ideal sleeping situation. Also, there is no menu for room service. In Mexico City, drinking tap water is not recommended. I was shocked to find out that a one liter bottle of drinking water costs 100$ mxn at the hotel. If it is not too late, I recommend going to the Oxxo store at Terminal 1 and buy one bottle for 23-25$ mxn.
So, in short, for +125€ for a one night stay for two persons, I sincerely do not recommend staying here, unless you have no other option, or your flight leaves very early in the morning the next day.
Positive Reviews:
First impression when coming in, the hotel looks really nice. It has a huge inner courtyard and the rooms are arranged around it, at least the ones from Tower 1. It is open 24/7 and you can make the check in easily when you come in. Also, the COVID security measures were followed during our stay, which made us feel more comfortable.
Two things that stand out the most are, the staff and the location. We had a couple of issues with our room and the staff was more than willing to help us out and accommodate us in a different room.
The beds have fresh sheets and are comfortable which allow for a good night sleep.
The location is unbeatable when you have a connecting flight the next day. The hotel facilities are connected and open 24/7 to Terminal 1. If your flight leaves or arrives at Terminal 2, the hotel has a free shuttle service from and to the terminal every 15-20 mins. Just make sure to ask in the front desk in case you are in a rush. 
Since we did not eat in the hotel or used any of the amenities I can not talk about them.

Negative Reviews: There was no hot water in the room. The hotel was hard to find in the airport. The gym and the so-called rooftop pool looked in dire need of renovation.
Positive Reviews: The building is impressive and our room was okay, although very bland. The breakfast buffet was great and worth the money. The location is relatively convenient, but the absence of signage in the terminals made it hard to find, especially when tired after a long flight.

Review Title: Would like to stay again for location but we don't fully trust giving credit card info to this hotel
Negative Reviews:
We booked a decent rate through booking.com and a couple of days before had a very worrying fraudulent email message supposedly direct from the Camino Real hotel via booking.com messages asking for credit card details via a link.  We were given 12 hours to give this info or they would cancel our room!  Booking.com internal messaging system messages take 24 hours to respond so we had no choice but to make sure this reservation was still secured.  In the end we called the hotel who were then alerted of this problem.  At check in we did not even feel comfortable giving a credit card as we felt their system had been compromised.
Room:  Sufficiently large enough.  However, there were not enough towels in the room for two occupants.  The room was supposed to be a quiet one, but we were right near a very steep hallway ramp which was super loud when guests left their rooms very early with luggage.  
The food and drink choices on site were ok but very expensive for the quality.
Positive Reviews: The location is the main reason why we chose this hotel.  The check in process was easy and the bathroom was nicely done/modern in style.  The beds and pillows overall were comfortable enough and 2 bottles of water provided.

Negative Reviews: In my room the floor of the bathroom smelled bad, like if the mop was not clean.
Positive Reviews: Best location if you are travelling. Good facilities and confortable beds. The restaurant is good.

Review Title: A Convenient and Comfortable Hotel for Airport Travelers
Negative Reviews: The only thing missing in the room was a fridge. The hotel is not that difficult to reach, but it would be much better if there would be some signs inside the airport when leaving the departure doors to understand in which direction to walk.
Positive Reviews: Camino Real Aeropuerto is an excellent choice for travelers passing through Mexico City's airport. The hotel's location is extremely convenient, as it is directly connected to the airport terminal. All you need to do is grab your luggage and take a quick 3-4 minute walk to the hotel lobby. The rooms are well-appointed, featuring air conditioning, clean bed sheets and towels, a wardrobe, safe box, TV, and even a cot for traveling families. The hotel also offers a variety of amenities including a gym, restaurant, travel office, store, and even a post box, so you can send a Mexican postcard directly from the hotel. On my previous stay, the rooms were a bit dated, but the hotel has recently undergone a big renovation and now all the rooms feel fresh and new. The check-in and check-out process was also super fast, so you won't have to worry about missing your flight. Overall, I highly recommend Camino Real Aeropuerto for anyone looking for a comfortable and convenient place to stay near Mexico City's airport.

Review Title: You pay the premium price for an airport hotel for an OK place to sleep in
Negative Reviews: The room was extremely damp and a strong smell of humidity got into all my suitcase and clothes from sleeping only 1 night in the room. The AC was cooling down the room but unfortunately not removing any humidity. We were located in the north tower which appears to be an older part of the hotel, which may be the reason why, but we should know at booking time.
Positive Reviews: The bed was comfortable, and the shower worked well. The location is unbeatable if you need to fly from/or arrive to the Terminal 1 of the airport. The wifi worked really well, however it's not possible to cast your own content to the television (and its HDMI ports are not accessible).

Negative Reviews: I have stayed before, but found it less clean than usual this time. There was hair on the floor, in the bed and in the shower. I expected more for the price.
Positive Reviews: For an airport hotel, the location is great -- it's connected to T1 by a walkway, and there's a bus from T2 as well. The pool and gym have great views over the airport and hills. The beds are very comfortable.

Negative Reviews: The restaurant/breakfast room is really ugly, with bright white lights, it’s really shocking. They should really make a small effort to make it look decent. And being an airport hotel you’d think the rooms would be better sound proofed! It is quite annoying. Thank god the beds were really comfortable because we did wake up multiple times during the night.
Positive Reviews: Great value for money and great location. The beds are amazing! That was an incredible surprise. Check in and Check out are quick and easy. There’s a bar which is really nice. A Mexican restaurant which is decent. Didn’t really get to have a good meal that night.

Negative Reviews: The staff are terrible and rude. Firstly, when we came, we arrived two days early as we departed our state to escape a blizzard we arrived at the hotel to request two additional days prior to our reservation. They would not accommodate at a similar rate, and wanted to charge us 300 more a night at $460, so we found the booking through hotels.com and got a better rate. Then we talked to the lady at the desk to have her merge our reservations so that we wouldn’t be locked out of our room on Friday the day of our original booking after returning from a tour, we found our rooms locked out And the staff were very rude and it took a while to fix the situation. Additionally, the air-conditioning does not work in this hotel and when I went to ask the hotel front desk for a Band-Aid they suggested I walk 20 minutes to the terminal to buy a Band-Aid they weren’t going to give me one. They did not have any sort of medical supplies, nor do they care to use them or provide their customers With any sort of comfort or support. We walk to the terminal and Starbucks gladly gave us a free Band-Aid. I can’t believe how rude insensitive, messy, uncomfortable and horribly unorganized this hotel is. In my honest opinion you’ll be better off at a motel six or just sleeping in the terminal.
Positive Reviews: I did not like anything about the property. Even the pool was poorly designed, cleaned and managed. It only had a decent view.

The room was cleaned properly everyday and the personnel friendly.

They know you will stay there because of the location,  so no effort there.

The bathroom door is semi transparent. And you can see through the edges. Dint stay with college in same room.

They have a millions rooms yet after a three day stay ( stranded at the airport) the latest check out I could get for a 7pm flight was 1:00pm

The pool looks tacky with fake grass carpeting and yellow tiles. It is a shame cause it is clean, and it has a great great view.

Review Title: A Convenient and Comfortable Hotel for Airport Travelers
Negative Reviews: The only thing missing in the room was a fridge. The hotel is not that difficult to reach, but it would be much better if there would be some signs inside the airport when leaving the departure doors to understand in which direction to walk. We visited the restaurant for breakfast but I would say that the service was lacking, even though there was not that much of customers, we had to wait enough for our food (ordered from the menu) and some parts from the order were not as initially requested.
Positive Reviews: Camino Real Aeropuerto is an excellent choice for travelers passing through Mexico City's airport. The hotel's location is extremely convenient, as it is directly connected to the airport terminal. All you need to do is grab your luggage and take a quick 3-4 minute walk to the hotel lobby. The rooms are well-appointed, featuring air conditioning, clean bed sheets and towels, a wardrobe, safe box, TV, and even a cot for traveling families. The hotel also offers a variety of amenities including a gym, restaurant, travel office, store, and even a post box, so you can send a Mexican postcard directly from the hotel. On my previous stay, the rooms were a bit dated, but the hotel has recently undergone a big renovation and now all the rooms feel fresh and new. The check-in and check-out process was also super fast, so you won't have to worry about missing your flight. Overall, I highly recommend Camino Real Aeropuerto for anyone looking for a comfortable and convenient place to stay near Mexico City's airport.

Review Title: Best location possible, pretty lobby and rooms, treatment could be better
Negative Reviews: There was a HUGE check-in problem when we arrived (dozens of people waiting for hours) and we never got offered any kind of compensation or courtesy for the problem. Room service is unreasonably expensive.
Positive Reviews: The location right next to the airport T1 is the best (no shuttle needed!). The lobby is amazing and the rooms are comfortable. Food is also excellent in the main restaurant.

Review Title: great location, crappy room  with no A/C and poor wifi.
Negative Reviews: A/C didn’t work, room was 26 degrees all night even after maintenance person looked at A/C. Poor wifi, torn carpet, stains in bathtub and faucet handle fell off of shower.
Positive Reviews: proximity to airport, great service in restaurant

Negative Reviews: The beds and the building is already becoming old.
Positive Reviews: Location, service, staff and food. Yummy!

Review Title: Great location, but a problematic room.
Negative Reviews:
Our room was a major disappointment. There was not a single towel rack in the bathroom! The beds were on wheels and they rolled around every time we slightly touched them. That was/is dangerous, especially in the middle of the night, when one needs to use the restroom! There was no mini-frig in the room. And the hallway had an unpleasant odor. 

We've stayed at this hotel many times before. This is the first time we were put in a room that was so disappointing. Possibly we were put in the older wing of the hotel. The room we were in definitely needs to be remodeled. I still can't believe that there was not a single towel rack in the entire bathroom. That's the first time I've experienced no towel rack in a chain hotel.
Positive Reviews: The location, attached to the International Terminal at the Mexico City Airport, and near the buses, is perfect. It's easy to walk across the bridge to get food. There are restaurants in the hotel and nearby. The staff are friendly and helpful. The entry area is modern and attractive. Many conveniences are offered. Overall, it was fairly quiet, given the hotel is so near the airport.

Review Title: Good place to stay near to the airport
Negative Reviews: At night, there was too much noise from the corridor; the rooms weren't noiseless.
Positive Reviews: I really like the location, the breakfast and the amability of the staff members

Review Title: The BEST LOCATION - But spotty Wifi
Negative Reviews:
WIFI did not work in my room on the 3rd floor.  I called the reception and they were not able to fix it. I asked if I could use their business center to take a call and they wanted to charge me $30 USDS to use it.
My family and I stayed in 2 separate rooms. WIFI worked well in the 7th floor so I had to take my call there.
I wish they had solved this issue.
Positive Reviews: The fact that the hotel connects to the airport through a tunnel is extremely convenient. The rooms are very comfortable and the food is good.

The executive level complimentary breakfast was poor.
Positive Reviews: Good location, little bit hard to find the entrance from the airport if you're unfamiliar with the terminal. Room was comfortable.

Positive Reviews: convenient and easy to get to airport, free shuttle to Terminal 2, onsite Covid testing with results in less than 30 min. Room was clean and comfortable.

Review Title: Great place for a comfortable and convenient overnight stop if flying into or out of Mexico city.

Quite far from city attractions, so not an ideal position if you are planning this hotel as your base for exploring mexico city.
Positive Reviews: This hotel is in an excellent location if you have an early flight departure (or late arrival) from/into Mexico city, as we did. There is a covered walkway directly from the hotel into Terminal 1. The beds are really comfortable and the hotel is quiet (ie you are not aware of vehicle or flight traffic noise) - so perfect for a good nights rest before or after a long flight. If you arrive before check in times there is an option of leaving luggage safely with the concierge.

Review Title: Great location but no a 4-star hotel
Negative Reviews:
The hotel is outdated.

Windows are shut so there is no airflow besides a small AC in the rooms.

If you want to request a shuttle late at night, you will need to talk with the "security" guard who I believe has some small guy complex, you will feel that he is doing you a favour instead of providing the service you are paying for.

Bathrooms don't have extractors so it can get a bit steamy and with a lack of windows, it could get a bit humid.

It is a 3-star hotel comparing other 4-star/3-star hotels I visited.
Positive Reviews:
The location is perfect if you are arriving at Juarez airport.

The hotel provides a shuttle to the airport for free (no tip included).

Good Service and most of the people working there are helpful and polite.

Positive Reviews: Super convenient to spend a night right by the airport. The hotel shuttle was very efficient and we barely had to wait to get picked up and dropped off. Bed was very comfortable!

Review Title: Convenient location but too dated and too dirty. Not worth it.
Negative Reviews: The price was way too high. I was surprised because I had stayed before but the rates were way higher than before. Also, because of the excessive price increase, I expected the facilities to have new carpet and new curtains (they were broken in the room and they wouldn't close all the way, which was inconvenient as we faced the airport which has a lot of lights blinking!). The worse was that the sink in the bathroom was not well cleaned. The drain in the bathtub did not drain properly and the air was stuffy. I have stayed at less rated hotels that are way cheaper but that were at least clean. I know the rates are higher because of the convenience of being at the airport, but this high and with dirty facilities is just unacceptable. We are considering never staying there any more. It used to be worth it. It no longer is.
Positive Reviews: Location close to airport. I love the choice of restaurants on the LB floor. Staff is very nice and helpful.

Review Title: Would give it at least a 9 if...
Negative Reviews:
I'd be inclined to give it this hotel a rating of 9 or even 10, if they would only offer in-room coffee!  There is a tiny starbucks in the hotel lobby, but strangely it opens really late for an airport hotel where guests are on the move early (the reception staff told me it opens at 8:30 or 9am!).  
   So I walked the pedestrian bridge to grab a coffee in the airport terminal, and took it back to my room.   To be fair, the hotel says you can order coffee early via room service... but I'm not going to pay room service price + tip for 1 cup of coffee that will be lukewarm by the time it gets to me.  
  Note to hotel Camino Real management: for the price paid, there should be a simple in-room coffee service.  Travelers appreciate easy coffee.

Positive Reviews: Excellent location for a layover in Mexico City, especially for late arrivals and early departures with its 24 hr desk. Located adjacent to Terminal 1 with walk-in access via a pedestrian overpass above puerto #4. Free and frequent shuttle bus service to Terminal 2. Clean room, x-large bed, friendly accommodating staff. Attractive lobby & restaurant. Food and drink services in Terminal 1 open 24/7.  Bonus: Reception desk also located on the Arrivals level of Terminal 2. Got checked-in and room key right there, with shuttle bus waiting outside for the 5 min drive to the hotel! We'll stay again if travelling thru Mexico City.

Review Title: EXTRAORDINARY!! I could stay here again and again!
Negative Reviews: I wish breakfast was served earlier, for early flights.
Positive Reviews:
We had a great stay at Camino Real, perfect to stay the night before an early flight!
Easy accessibility from Terminal 2 of CDMX international airport via a walkway that connects the building (no need to even take a taxi!). Terminal 1 is  just a short walk across the corridor.
Restaurant in site, modern facilities, excellent location!
Indoor pool and gym installations were amazing overlooking the airport runway.
There was happy hour and complimentary snacks for the executive floor.
Laundry service available 24 hrs, we were able to take a swim at night and have our swimsuits ready within an hour.
We needed an ice pack for a head bump, a nurse was sent to our room to assist.
Everybody was very nice, helpful and welcoming, they even help me to look for a missing object I left behind in the room!
Room Type: Camino Real Club King - Breakfast Included for Adults Only

The restaurant was abysmal, it was as bad as eating in a cafeteria. We were told there was a buffet, it was closed and only old salad fixings available.  The wait staff were clearly overwhelmed.  The hotel is badly in need of a thorough remodel and cleaning.  The lobby and bar furniture were smelly, lumpy and filthy.  The hallways to the room are filthy and need updating.  The room appeared worn and 
lightly cleaned, although the bed was comfortable.

Review Title: Not like the Camino Real hotels I’ve known.
Negative Reviews:
I have a 16 lb roller bag, no getting around the two valets from car to room. Not necessary. 

Ignored at the lobby bar at 6pm on a Friday for 30 min. I finally got some attention when I sat at the actual bar. I wish I had dinner there but they never offered me a menu. I found it later they had a bar menu. 

I apprised the doorman of a leak in the roof (it was raining). He seemed put out to have to do something about it; never said a word. 

La Mansion restaurant was nice, though the music was very loud for that type of restaurant.  I had an appetizer and 3 wines for $70 with tip

Breakfast is a $30 buffet with tip and so-so

I feel the hotel is run of the mill, indifferent service, and very pretentious.

Positive Reviews: Nice room, great view for me. Nice breakfast Staff  were ok

Review Title: A good option if you need an airport hotel
Positive Reviews: I had a situation where I needed a hotel right by the airport in order to be able to give an address and wait for lost luggage. By the way, United Airlines handled the lost luggage situation beautifully, and I was very pleased. It is a very nice room, a little bit older, but with a comfortable bed instead of those hard as concrete hotel beds one often finds in Mexico. The shower was great, the towels were great, and if you speak Spanish, there are a wealth of TV channels to choose from. Conveniently located right across from the airport. The concierge staff were super helpful and super friendly. If an emergency came up where I needed to use a hotel close to the airport again, I would stay here. If pressed for any thing negative to say, well, there was a musty old  room smell, but it absolutely was not a dealbreaker. I found these nice heavy blankets to keep warm, though, there were issues with the central air unit, with getting heating. And I never figured out how to get it to heat the room. A most impressive breakfast! And impressed by the quality of cleanliness. On departure I saw them scrubbing down the elevators.

Review Title: Can’t fault this hotel as it had everything we needed
Negative Reviews: Nothing, it was much better than expected for the price
Positive Reviews: Perfect location if you are flying out from Mexico City, just 150m walk to Terminal 1. The staff were great the rooms were spacious and comfortable and the food in the restaurant was delicious.

This was a great choice for staying at the airport between flights. On the way in to CDMX, we stayed at the Courtyard Marriott which was more expensive and really, offered similar amenities. Room was clean, bed comfy, and even though we had a full view of the runway, I barely heard the planes taking off. They offer 24 hour room service if you need to grab food before a really early flight. Staff were polite and helpful. They have a gym but we didn't check it out since our stay was short. Can't beat the location; there's a walkway to get to terminal 1 of the airport in less than 2 minutes.
Big rooms, very close to the airport, nice staff and good restaurants in the Hotel. The steakhouse is a must visit place! Good gym nad pool with the view on the landingstrip.

Negative Reviews:
I stayed in a room that included hot & cold snacks in the evening. I was so dissapointed with the pre-made platter they gave us. It was a 1/4 cold (I assume it was hot when they made it)  ham&cheese sandwich, a small cup with 2-3 oz of ceviche, and a tiny piece of cake, about one square inch. Not kidding! I should have taken a picture. 
The breakfast they serve for this type of room is also limited.  You're better off renting a regular room and buy your food at the restaurant or at the airport across the bridge, 2 minutes away; lots of choices there.
The swimmingpool is another story. There are no sitting areas to relax. It is not an appealing atmosphere.
Positive Reviews: The proximity to the airport. I also enjoyed getting a massage in the spa.
Room Type: Camino Real Club King - Breakfast Included for Adults Only

Review Title: Location trumps everything if you have a flight to catch and dont care about touring the city.

It took me 2 minutes to get an answer to the question - "when does your breakfast buffet starts ?" ....she kept on saying Breakfast is not included - as if a guest would only ask for free food after paying USD$168 room fare. (And please smile when greeting your guests - basic hospitality or even basic courtesy - least one expects when checking into a hotel!)
Positive Reviews: It is connected from the airport - so no hassle of taxi - direct skybridge above Gate 4 (Level PB) and you are inside the hotel lobby. The proximity to airport is the best part of this hotel and comparatively lower rates (than Hilton, Mariott etc)

Swimming pool has a nice view but there are no beds to chill out. At the reception when check-in they don't provide with any information (except check-out and breakfast time), you must ask for everything by yourself.

Review Title: I will not stay there anymore.
Negative Reviews:
Lazy and arrogant front desk attendant. Although there was no one to serve in front of me, she asked me to wait and I was waiting and waiting for a good half hour to be served. She asked me to pay for the room in advance, so I did with cash (Mexican Pesos). She took the money but refused to give me any kind of receipt. I was worried that the money would be lost. Finally during my checking out early morning next day, I received a receipt for the room as being paid. 

The hotel is outdated. 

The hotel keeps sending me messages (I assume to review them) but all in Spanish.
Positive Reviews: Close proximity to the airport

Review Title: Hotel, cleanliness, staff is good, location is excellent, but these points should be improved...
Negative Reviews:
1. The room was on first floor and did not have transparent window. There was no view from the room. It should be mentioned on booking.com to get an idea when booking the room.

2. The air conditioner temperature control did not work. It was too cold or you have to switch off the aircon that leaves you suffocated.
Positive Reviews: Location is ideal to reach airport. You can just walk through the tunnel that connects airport terminal 1 with the hotel.

Review Title: Convenient for the airport & would definitely stay here again
Negative Reviews: My only negative is that there’s no information about the hotel in the room - ie which floor the restaurants are on, whether it has a swimming pool etc.
Positive Reviews:
Being able to walk into this hotel from the airport is fantastic.  It’s a big hotel with friendly, helpful staff.  Clean rooms with good facilities.
Huge choice buffet breakfast - expensive but worth it if you can eat a lot!

convenient location, clean, comfortable 
great staff and facilities
Lovely spacious room. Comfortable beds and extremely convenient for airport. Filtered tap in the bathroom was helpful.

Negative Reviews: I went down for coffee in the morning because I has an early flight out and NEED coffee,  but the cafe was closed--it opened shortly after 7 but at an airport you'd think it would open earlier.
Positive Reviews: After reading some of the reviews here, I thought the hotel was going to be a little run down and outdated, but I was pleasantly surprised. This is not a boutique hotel, it's an airport hotel in Mexico city and not everything in Mexico is dirt cheap. I don't understand all the complaints. The hotel staff answered my email inquiries before arriving. I waited about 10 minutes coming and going for the free airport shuttle. Check in was efficient (yes, there was a line because you are at the busiest airport in Latin America and the hotel has a lot of rooms). Great water pressure, comfortable bed and sheets, nice lighting, good veggie sandwich at the bar/cafe, and the staff who helped me print some documents for my trip were very nice--everyone was very nice and accommodating. I'd return without hesitation.

Negative Reviews: My room Smelled damp. The facilities need a remodel to be worth the price you pay! Need better pillows for the beds
Positive Reviews: The service was good. It was clean everything.  Good food .

Positive Reviews: Location, amazing breakfast, comfy bed

Review Title: Convenient for catching an early morning flight from MEX
Negative Reviews: Poor signage in the terminal (T1) for getting to the hotel. Fortunately for me, I had been there before, so I knew how to find the bridge between the terminal and property.
Positive Reviews: Convenient location when catching an early morning flight from MEX. Well designed, functional room. Rapid check-in and check-out. Good Mexican restaurant on site. Good internet.

Negative Reviews: Only the long Q at check-in.
Positive Reviews: I got a nice comfortable room with a view of the airport, that allowed me to see the planes landing.  Had a long Q at check-in but there will always be certain "hot" times for check-in. Check-out was seamless. I just dropped off the key card. Room was clean and had most of the essentials. No razor or room slippers I could see. Wonderful location, just across a bridge from Terminal 1. I think it's a little complicated if you arrive at Terminal 2. The 2 terminals are a little distance apart. A friend who landed there found the hotel's booth at Terminal 2 that arranged a free taxi to the hotel. Good and plentiful choices at breakfast. 425 pesos for buffet if it is not included in room price. Highly recommended if you have an early flight or land late at night.

Review Title: Excellent Hotel very close to the airport
Positive Reviews:
We had a flight at 6:30 in the morning and the hotel location is excellent.  It's connected directly with Terminal 1 by a pedestrian bridge.  It's also a short walk to the metro via the airport, so we were able to go to town easily for dinner the night before our flight.

The room was large, clean and very comfortable.  The beds were really comfortable and we slept well.
Excellent location,place very clean.very good breakfast.

Review Title: It ticked all points I needed.

Negative Reviews: Shower was a bit tidus to turn on, it worked though. They offer a pad rolled up, I recommend using it in the shower, tiles get really slippery and dangerous.
Positive Reviews: Room was clean and comfortable, didn't order room service but options were available. The tv had entertainment but was difficult to get English subtitles going. You could also cast a device to the tv.

Negative Reviews: Inconsistency with covid19 checks, it was only done randomly upon entering the hotel. I feel either do it or don't do it. don't have do it. Parts of the hotel look a bit tired however that being said it was comfortable and clean in my experience here.
Positive Reviews:
Comfortable bed, pillows and big towels.
Airport right next to the hotel - I personally didn't notice and discomfort from any aircraft noise (that I can remember)
Connected via bridge to the terminal. The hotel offers COVID 19 testing on site.
Went to the restaurant connected to the hotel La Maison I think it's called - very good. Friendly staff, lots of covid19 measures in place in the restaurant and some of the food is cooked at your table.

Review Title: Great if you are looking for a layover or have an early morning flight to catch!
Negative Reviews: However, the room (especially the bathroom) was not the cleanest.
Positive Reviews: Great idea if you are looking for an overnight stay/ layover as it's literally across the airport. The room was quite decent, and the room service (got a club sandwich) was very very nice!!

Negative Reviews: Well, where do I begin? When I booked my room? I booked it with a city view which was good because it looked at over the airport so I could see planes taking off and landing which was nice but we did ask for a larger room and we were only given a really small room. The room number was 8140 but I must admit the bed was very comfortable and I did sleep very well, but we were there for two nights and on both occasions we had breakfast in the morning in the executive lounge and the breakfast was absolutely disgusting. The food that was meant to be hot was really cold and all you had for options for hot food in executive lounge was omelette that was overcooked and cold refried beans and pancakes and all the rest was cold stuff like ham, cheese, fruit and pastries so for the money I paid for this hotel was absolutely disgusting but we do love the hotel for its location and everything else but it needs to be upgraded in the executive lounge
Positive Reviews: The only thing I liked about this hotel was the location from the airport which meant I did not have to travel far when I had my flight and the gentleman who was on the executive floor lounge in the evening was a very nice guy. He remembered me from previous visits which was very nice of him to recognise me.
Room Type: Camino Real Club King - Breakfast Included for Adults Only

Negative Reviews:
To start with, there are no signage inside the airport directing you to the hotel, had to find my own way by asking around.
Incredibly disappointed with staff. Witnessed a porter asked an oriental looking lady if she wanted help with her luggage, She did not respond (probably because she does not speak Spanish), and then the porter proceeded to make fun of her calling her derogatory names in Spanish, and 3-4 other porters laughed out loud! incredible rude and uprofessional. 
Next, there is an open yard in the courtyard, There was a guy clearly intoxicated and being obnoxious. Why did the bar staff let him get to this degree of intoxication?
Since the courtyard is open, noise carries to rooms, It is not relaxing to hear loud music and laughter past midnight
The shower has no door or curtain, so water splashed outside to the toilet area, Really inconvenient.
Positive Reviews: Just location, right next to the airport

To enter the hotel there's a ten step stairway and the ramp on the side is incredible steep.  The parking arrangement is inconvenient.  I have concluded that by reserving through Booking I get a good rate but the hotel provides the worst rooms.

Positive Reviews: Convenience, cleanliness, pleasant staff.

Negative Reviews: The room needs updating for the price charged
Positive Reviews:
All of the staff were extremely kind, helpful, attentive and genuine...they were the highlight of my one night stay.
The hotel itself needs a facelift both in the rooms and common areas so I found it a bit overpriced for a standard room. The bed was comfortable and it was relatively quiet even though I was right beside the elevator. 
The food and drinks in the bar were reasonably priced and good...service was quick and friendly as well.
Overall, Camino Real Aeropuerto is a good place to stay overnight for flight or bus connections. It's located a fair walking distance from the T1 bus terminal and flight check-in so if you have a lot of luggage, there are porters at the hotel and additional porters at the bridge to the hotel

You could hear some noise form the airport considering our room which faced the terminal, but it did not keep us up.  Staff courteous and they help you with the bags coming in.  Starbucks in the lobby.

I tried to tell him but he did not listen and I was coming from a 12h flight so I just let it go, but if someone says no they should stop asking you.

I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I would stay there again.

well where to begin??? after booking three months in advance and as we have been to this hotel many times we always book a room with a city view looking over the airports in the mountains and the room is always a big room but on our first visit to our first room it was really small and you could not even have a view you could not see anything except the car park and when we went up to our second room it was a two bedded room with no view and then they put us in a room with two beds also but in a more expensive room and when we walked in and out of the room there was plaster and dirt all over the floor to the entrance of the room so all in all this trip what is the most terrible experience we have had from this hotel in previous visits it has been really nice but this is the worst and we also had 
and we also ate in the restaurant for breakfast and lunch and I can honestly say without any shadow of a doubt it was disgusting it was tasteless it was uninviting it was cold and we paid 900 pesos for breakfast the only thing that was okay well reasonably okay was the fruit but that wasn’t much good anyway I had watermelon and it was all a mush in the bowl they put it in The only thing that was hot when I had it on my plate what is the waffles which I had with cream and maple syrup The coffee was lukewarm and the green juice tasted burnt and tasted of nothing all you could taste was bitter ingredients 
So all in all a very very disappointing visit even though we go there on a regular basis but I think we will start going to another hotel in the airport when I arrive

Review Title: Our room had seen better times
Negative Reviews:
When we arrived, the room was clean, but it is evident that it has not been upgraded in a while, especially the bathroom. For example, the toilet was evidently old and there where not typical appliances such as hair dryer. Considering the price per night, I would expect it to be more "new" and equipped.   
Despite being an airport hotel, the restaurants are closed until 6 am. It would be convenient if they opened earlier. You can order room service at any time if you have to leave early and want to eat something before leaving the hotel, but the prices are quite high.
We stayed for 2 nights, and in most hotels you'd expect that someone comes to clean after the first night, but when we came back in the afternoon it was clear that no one had come. It was not a big issue for us because it was only one day and of course we did not have a mess, but that is not what you should expect for in a high quality hotel.

Review Title: Nice hotel…but under construction! if you are looking for quiet stay elsewhere
Negative Reviews: I called before booking to make sure we could get a late check out because we arrived at 5am and desperately needed sleep before check out, they were kind enough to give us an extra hour. I messaged the hotel several times notifying them of our late arrival and need for sleep. The room we were assigned was right next to the very loud hammering, and fire exit so we were woken up many times and finally when the hammering wouldn’t stop I called and the front desk was gracious enough to put us in the main tower we’re there was still construction but at least it was a little further away. I don’t expect them to have considered our room placement knowing our situation but it would have been nice. The staff did everything possible to make it better which we really appreciated. The second room we stayed in was so much nicer than the first and was probably at the same price point.

I arrived at the reception desk at 01:01, as the flight was a little late, to find they had cancelled my room and charged the credit card that I used for the reservation at 23:30.  The receptionist was very rude.  She did find us a room, when we went to it, someone was already occupying it (our key opened their door though, not very secure), and she did not tell us about the Club room for breakfast just said breakfast was not included in the rate.  The hotel was being refurbished, so there was building works noise from 8am, which we could hear clearly with the 3cm gap under the room door.  This hotel really is the worst of the 3 options at Terminal 1 for the ones that you can walk to.  Try the Hilton or Marriott, or one of the ones with the short shuttle.

To be fair the rest of the staff, the concierge, the Club room breakfast staff, were all wonderful, just the receptionist needs some attitude training.
Room Type: Camino Real Club King - Breakfast Included for Adults Only

Review Title: This place needs a serious update
Negative Reviews: All the restaurants have horrible lighting. Think eating at OXXO. Same with the rooms. No lamps only overhead light. AC is awful. Barely does anything. BTW, only rooms on two floors have coffee makers. This is so outdated. Room service is lame.
Positive Reviews: Lobby is decent.

Negative Reviews:
I arrived with my sister and my mother at the Camino Real Hotel on February 14, 2024, to celebrate my mother 81st birthday which was February 14, 2024. We planned to visit the Basilica of our Lady of Guadalupe for the 3 days we were in Mexico since it has always been my mother’s desire to visit. I elected to stay at the Camino Real property which was located right next to the airport by Terminal 1 because I thought it would be extremely convenient and would be easier for my mother as far a long-distance travel was concerned. However, this proved to be a mistake with unfortunate consequences for my family. Upon arrival to the property around 4:30 -5:00 PM, we were greeted well by the front desk person (male). I specifically explained that I was traveling with my elderly mother for her birthday, and I politely ask for a quiet room on the property. The young man who checked us in assured us that the room he was assigning us (room 5115) would be comfortable and quiet. This proved to be misleading because, that night at about 8:00 P.M. an extremely loud street party began. The music was so loud that the walls in the hallway vibrated. The hallway and our room sounded like we were in the inside of a speaker. We could see the main stage from outside our room window as will as the moving spotlight which would pass by the window in our room. Not to mention the constant loud voice over the speaker of the announcer who was the mater of ceremony during the event. This loud noise lasted until 3:00 A.M.

I went down to the front desk and asked to speak with the manager on duty; I stated that the situation was unacceptable and that we needed another room and a quit one as we had requested and had been promised when we had checked in. I was told that they did not have any control over the street party and that there was nothing they could do. I insisted that this was not an acceptable reply. We were offered free breakfast; however, I informed the manager that we had already paid

Air condition didn't work.
They changed my room, but also there the air condition didn't work. One of the employees told me that because the hotel is fully booked, the central air condition is not enough to cool all the rooms.
The safe box didn't work also.
The bath is old and has different corroded parts.
No room service menu on the rooms.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is located in the airport itself, good if you want to reach your flight quickly.

Review Title: Good in general, but disappointed with prices of water and service of staff
Negative Reviews:
A 750ml bottle of drinking water costs USD 12. They only provide 2 small bottles of water per night and anything extra is an additional cost. First hotel I have been to in a country where tap water is not potable and they charge you unrealistic prices for water.
As per my stay, I was offered a complimentary snack. I asked to if I could have it in my room since I was with a baby and she was sleeping, they agreed, but expected a tip when I was expected to take the food to my room. Not sure why I was asked for a tip for no service.

When we needed to change rooms, due to strong paint smell, the hotel stuff didn’t come to help us with our luggage, even though they had told us they would send someone. We ended up moving all our luggage ourselves. In general the support received by the staff was mediocre at best.

The hotel itself is clean and pleasant! The staff does an excellent job. Review Title: A disaster. Place needs gutting and a full renovation; staff need to be trained in customer service.
Negative Reviews: See above.
Positive Reviews: Other than the hotel was across a skywalk from the airport, nothing was acceptable. First room stank of smoking and liquor and the rug looked like a beerhall flooring. The room was sodirty, staples and paper on the floor; walls were black with grit. Bathrooms had been redone and were O.K. Bed linens were stained yellow and had large spots left on them. The sheets obviously were not properly cleaned. They finally moved me although the desk was surly about it and dragged their feet on doing it. Second room was likewise terrible and it stank even more. I checked out at 3:30 AM because the smell was activating my asthma. I'd woken up with a blinding headache that left me dizzy. Note: My flight was not until 11:00AM so I had a long 5d one-half hour- uncomfortable wait in the airport but it was better than this hotel. In 82 countries, this is at the top of my list for horrible establishments. Oh, and the front office staff couldn't care less!

Negative Reviews: I have stayed here before and it's nice.  This time, Booking.com asked if I wanted to request a quiet room.  I said "sure, why not?"  So, this time, I got placed in a different area, in the old building where you go down around through a long ugly service area to get to something that feels like a motel -it's more decrepit like a uitility building - low ceilings, frosted room window facing service area.  Still fancy appointments, great bed fine for an overnight but not the feel of the other side - just the same high price.    I don't know how to be sure you are not getting shoved into the old building but maybe ask for a view.  I will try to remember not to take booking.com's suggestion of requesting quiet again, that's for sure. Not for this hotel.

To get to the room you had to go up and down ramps that were connected by metal grates.  Looked liked you were heading to the service entrance.  It was bad.

Negative Reviews: Unfortunately, this is my first bad review at this hotel, after staying there for at least 3 times in the last few years. The room that was assigned to me was not properly clean, and facilities were rough. Overall, Camino Real is great, and I hope this bad experience is a one off.

Positive Reviews: It was connected to the airport via a gangway. Came in really late, the staff was courteous and helpful. The room was clean and spacious. Great for an overnight layover stay.

Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: Our international flight to Mexico City was delayed due to a timetable change, necessitating a night an this airport hotel. It is a pity all airport hotels are not as accessible and comfortable as this one. Arriving late it was great to be able to access the hotel from a footbridge near exit 4 of the international terminal. The checkin was seamless, the staff spoke excellent English. The room was spacious and very well insulated, the king bed was super comfortable with nice linens and towels and Molton Brown toiletries. We had a connecting flight the next morning from terminal 2 and a free hotel shuttle bus took us there.

Negative Reviews:
Something to keep in mind- this is an airport hotel so there are guests leaving/arriving at all times of the night. This made it quite noisy although it is to be expected for this type of hotel.
Not their fault but there was some confusion over the payment which could have been avoided if we could have paid before arrival. The problem was the amount seemed more than we had expected but it was actually just a minor difference due to conversion rates. Still, my preference would be to pay before arrival and I wish the property/booking.com would have allowed this.
Positive Reviews:
It was very close to the airport, accessible via a footbridge so you don't have to cross the road.
The room was very large and well equipped with toiletries etc.
It had a 24/hr reception desk which we appreciated as our flight didn't get in until 1am and we had to leave at 6am.
The bed was very comfortable.
They had a shuttle service to other terminals.
Free WiFi.

so all in all the hotel was nice, but the reservations area needs to be sorted and also I did book the junior suite with city view and on my last few occasions of going to this hotel. Negative Reviews:
Hi,
Very disappointing and scary experience I had last night when staying in the hotel, I would not stay in this place again. Please see my review below

Early in the morning I heart I massive noice by the bathroom just before I was getting up to take a shower to get ready for my plane. What was my surprise that when I get in the bathroom part of the ceiling Had fallen down in the floor. It was part of the thick layer of pain plus some concrete (please refer to my pictures below).
If I would have gone earlier to take shower, this could have ended up in a massive and serious situation for myself, accident!!!

I immediately called the reception so I could have another room to take shower as I was taking a plane couple of hours after.

When I went down to the reception to check out, I don’t feel they really take this seriously and address the issue in the best way as they only apologised and they mentioned that another room was offered to just take shower. This is a hotel that I paid £100 per night? I would have expected that the manager would came and talked to me, but didn’t happen. The service was good, I have to leave cause of my plane. They took just my email address and mentioned they will contact me. I believe this a serious issue that could have ended up in a terrible accident. 
The rooms are not well maintained and look very old. Please check all rooms and give some maintenance so other guest are safe!

Terrible experience!

What I am very very dissapointed at: I had to wait for more than an hour for the hotel free shuttle bus. This while up to two times the employee in the airport office told me the shuttle would be coming in 10-15 minutes. When the shuttle arrived I mentioned again the shuttle was late. No apologies from the chauffeur and no explanation. I also mentioned it at the counter when checking in. Again no apologies. No courtesy. When you arrive after a pretty long travel and that is the first experience with the hotel and related services, that first impression is terrible. Note: During the ride with the shuttle bus I could conclude traffic was no excuse for the delay. When the information would be: it can take up to an hour. Than you know and can make the decision whether you are willing to wait for that time. Or that you  are prepared to spend some money and take another form of transport to the hotel.

Negative Reviews: this hotel is located at terminal 1.  if you land and takeoff from there, by all means, stay here— it’s close and very easy.  however, if you land or take off from terminal 2, you might as well stay anywhere, as it’s not nearly as close as it seems.  the 15 minute wait for the free hotel shuttle outside T2 plus a 15-20 minute drive OUT of the airport, into traffic, and around and back in the airport to T1 makes not as convenient as you expected.  there is the airport tram option which is somewhat faster, but for some reason the hotel doesn’t tell you about this.

Review Title: rooms good, service bad, be aware of price changes according your bookings as they might not be righ
Negative Reviews:
The hotel is located at Terminal 2 for International flights. I had to take a very early flight at 6 AM at Terminal 1 (National Flights) and the free train shuttle that takes you there was not available till 5 AM. Noting that the train shuttle takes 15 minutes to transport you from Terminal 2 to Terminal 1 for national flights and another 15 minutes including check-ins plus standing in line for early national flights, I would not have made it. I had to take a bus transfer which cost me 20 MXN pesos, which I did not anticipate but had to run to catch it on time as only 1 bus drove during the early hours. Otherwise, it was waiting another 30 minutes for catching the next, which would have cost me losing my flight.

So the transportation from the hotel and airport should have been different if the hotel would have offered me a free ride at my disposal to be on time at check-in and the Terminal 1. They did not offer anything nor free rides. Or they did not inform me about that.

Also, they tried to trick me on my reservation and charged me much more than I reserved for, suddenly the price was 153 US Dollars a night but I booked for 136 US Dollars. After arguing with the clerk and showing a reservation by phone he admitted he made a mistake.  They try every time the same trick to convince you the price has been changed due to whatever, I had a similar situation 2 years ago with the same hotel, so be aware.
Positive Reviews: Camino Real is accessible directly from the airport which is recommendable for travelers on international flights, hence that is why they are located at the international arrival terminal 1. By walking through a tunnel bridge you are immediately in the hotel for check-in, which gives you a safe and secure feeling, without leaving the airport environment, which is recommendable to stay inside the airport for foreign travelers.
Walking into the hotel directly from the Airport
